>@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.Item.hIhgdXnqGHBm0A64]{Envoy Improvisation}

@Icon[type:language-dependent] @Icon[type:mind-affecting] @Icon[type:sense-dependent]

Your retorts further embarrass enemies who have already failed. As a reaction when a creature within 60 feet misses you with an attack, you can taunt them. The creature gains the @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.conditions.Item.yUtkoIshf4dPruNd]{Off-Target} condition until the end of your next turn (Will negates). You can use this improvisation against a creature with whom you donâ€™t share a language, but the creature gains a +4 bonus to its Will save against the effect. Once a creature successfully saves against this improvisation, it is immune to your sting of failure for 1 hour.

At 6th level, you can spend a Resolve Point when you use this ability to enhance its effect. The creature becomes off-target until the end of your next turn (no save), during which time they cannot take reactions (save negates).

duration.value: Until the end of your next turn
